alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 9:01PM EDT until April 13 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Saluda and Newberry Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 120.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:55 PM EDT Monday was 120.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 110.4 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.
